get.summary: Read configuration of auth server profile
get.description:
Use this API to configure an external RADIUS server for user authentication. You can configure parameters such as server IP, authentication port, accounting port,
shared key, etc. This feature is applicable for all devices.

post.summary: Create a new auth server profile by unique name

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Auth Server.

get.summary: Read existing auth server profile configuration

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Auth Server.

patch.summary: Update existing auth server profile configuration

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Auth Server.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Auth Server.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaAuthServer_AuthServersSchema.description:
Use this API to configure an external RADIUS server for user authentication. You can configure parameters such as server IP, authentication port, accounting port,
shared key, etc. This feature is applicable for all devices.

name.description: The name of the Auth Server.

type.description:
Auth Server Type. AP support server types are RADIUS, LDAP, TACACS and XMLAPI.
CX supports server types RADIUS and TACACS. PVOS supports RADIUS and TACACS.
Type is a mandatory parameter for CX and PVOS and can not be modified.
GW supports RADIUS, TACACS, WINDOWS and LDAP

x-enumDescriptions.AUTH_ONLY: RADIUS server is used only for authentication.
x-enumDescriptions.COA_ONLY: RADIUS server is used only for Change of Authorization (CoA).
x-enumDescriptions.AUTH_AND_COA: RADIUS server is used for both authentication and CoA.

radius-server-mode.description:
Specifies the mode in which the RADIUS server is used.
- AUTH_ONLY: Server is used only for authentication.
- COA_ONLY: Server is used only for Change of Authorization (CoA).
- AUTH_AND_COA: Server is used for both authentication and CoA.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

The domain-name type represents a DNS domain name.
Fully quallified left to the models which utilize this type.

Internet domain names are only loosely specified.  Section
3.5 of RFC 1034 recommends a syntax (modified in Section
2.1 of RFC 1123).  The pattern above is intended to allow
for current practice in domain name use, and some possible
future expansion.  It is designed to hold various types of
domain names, including names used for A or AAAA records
(host names) and other records, such as SRV records.  Note
that Internet host names have a stricter syntax (described
in RFC 952) than the DNS recommendations in RFCs 1034 and
1123, and that systems that want to store host names in
schema nodes using the domain-name type are recommended to
adhere to this stricter standard to ensure interoperability.

The encoding of DNS names in the DNS protocol is limited
to 255 characters.  Since the encoding consists of labels
prefixed by a length bytes and there is a trailing NULL
byte, only 253 characters can appear in the textual dotted
notation.

Domain-name values use the US-ASCII encoding.  Their canonical
format uses lowercase US-ASCII characters.  Internationalized
domain names MUST be encoded in punycode as described in RFC
3492

auth-server-address.description: IP address or FQDN of the Auth server. For CX and PVOS, auth-server-address is a mandatory parameter and can not be modified.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).

xmlapi-server-key.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.

enable-radsec.description:
Enables RadSec for RADIUS data transport over TCP and TLS
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS.
For CX and PVOS, this parameter cannot be modified.

authentication-type.description:
Specifies authentication protocol which is used for communication with Auth servers.
If not specified, the global timeout value will be picked. This field can be configured only when type is TACACS OR RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

auth-port.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.
auth-port.description:
Port number for authentication requests.For CX, default auth-port for RADIUS Servers is 1812 and TACACS Servers is 49.
For CX and PVOS, this parameter cannot be modified.

acct-port.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.
acct-port.description:
Port number for accounting requests.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

tcp-port.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.
tcp-port.description:
Port number used by the server.
This field can be configured only when type is TACACS

max-retransmit-attempts.description:
Maximum number of retries sent to the server by the manager device(AP, GW and SW_CX) before the server is marked as down.
For AP, the default value is 3.
For CX, range is 0-5. If not specified, the global retry value will be picked.

timeout.description:
Maximum time, in seconds, that the manager device(AP, GW and SW_CX) waits before timing out the request and resending it.
For CX, range is 1-60. If not specified, the global timeout value will be picked.
For AP, the default value of RADIUS and LDAP is 5, TACACS is 20.
This field can be configured only when type is TACACS, LDAP, or RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

source-address.description: Source IP address to use in messages to the Auth server

source-interface.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
source-interface.description:
Source VLAN Interface to use in messages to the Auth server
This field can be configured only when type is TACACS or RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

nas-ip-address.description: The NAS IP address to be sent in RADIUS packets from that server.

nas-identifier.description:
NAS identifier to use in RADIUS packets.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

cppm-user-name.description:
User name of the ClearPass server to authenticate.
For CX, supported length is 2-64.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

x-enumDescriptions.STANDARD: Follow RFC, the default Service-Type for 802.1x is framed, for CP is Login, for mac is Call-Back.
x-enumDescriptions.FRAMED: Change Service-Type default value to framed for 802.1x, CP and MAC auth.

service-type.x-typeDescription: Change the default value of service type.
service-type.description:
Change Service Type default value to framed.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA

use-ip-for-calling-station-id.description:
Use IP for Calling Station Id.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

use-md5.description:
Use MD5 hash for cleartext password.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

lower-case-mac-address.description:
Lower case MAC address.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

mac-address-delimiter.description:
MAC address delimiter.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

vrf.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.
vrf.description:
VRF for the Auth server.
For CX, this parameter cannot be modified.

management-interface.description: Out of Band management interface for the Auth server.

radsec-port.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.
radsec-port.description:
Designates a RadSec port for RADIUS data transport
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA and enable-radsec is set to true.
For CX and PVOS, this parameter cannot be modified.

radsec-client-cert.description:
RADIUS Security Client Certificate Name.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA

radsec-trusted-cacert-name.description:
RADIUS Security Trusted CA Cert Name.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA

radsec-trusted-servercert-name.description:
RADIUS Security Server Certificate Name.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

radsec-est-cert-profile.description:
RADIUS Security Server Certificate Name.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

admin-dn.description:
DN for the admin user who has read or search privileges across all of the entries in the LDAP database (the user does not need
write privileges but should be able to search the database and read attributes of other users in the database).
This field can be configured only when type is LDAP.

admin-password.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
admin-password.description:
Password for the admin user.
this field can be configured only when type is LDAP.

base-dn.description:
DN name of the node which contains the entire user database to use.
this field can be configured only when type is LDAP.

allow-cleartext.description:
Allow unencrypted communication with LDAP server.
this field can be configured only when type is LDAP.

chase-referrals.description:
LDAP Chase Referrals.
this field can be configured only when type is LDAP.

filter.description:
Filter that should be applied to search of the user in the LDAP database.
this field can be configured only when type is LDAP

key-attribute.description:
The attribute that should be used as a key in search
for the LDAP server. This field can be configured only when type is LDAP

max-connection.description:
Maximum number of simultaneous non-admin connections to a LDAP server.
this field can be configured only when type is LDAP

session-authorization.description:
Enable TACACS+ authorization.
this field can be configured only when type is TACACS.

domain.description:
Windows domain name.
this field can be configured only when type is WINDOWS.

replay-protection.description:
Replay protection for DAC(Dynamic Authorization Client) requests
this field can be configured only when type is RADIUS and radius-server-mode is equal to COA_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

x-enumDescriptions.POSITIVE: Sets the acceptable time-window value as default PLUS
x-enumDescriptions.PLUS_OR_MINUS: Sets the acceptable time-window value as PLUS OR MINUS

window-type.x-typeDescription: Time-window value type for dynamic authorization messages.

event-timestamp-required.description:
Discard DAC request, if Event-Timestamp is not present
in DAC(Dynamic Authorization Client) request. This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as COA_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

default-authenticated-role.description:
Assign default role for users after XML server
 authorization.

x-enumDescriptions.CLEAR_TEXT: set preferred connection type as Clear-Text
x-enumDescriptions.LDAP_S: set preferred connection type as LDAP-S
x-enumDescriptions.START_TLS: set preferred connection type as START-TLS

preferred-conn-type.x-typeDescription: Include VLAN identifier of port in acce7ss-request
preferred-conn-type.description:
Preferred Connection Type.
this field can be configured only when type is LDAP.

auth-modifier.description:
Attributes modifier for authentication-request.
this field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

acct-modifier.description:
Attributes modifier for accounting-request.
this field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA

deadtime.description:
Configures a dead time interval for the authentication server. When two or more authentication servers are configured on the Instant AP and
a server is unavailable, the dead time configuratidetermines the duration for which the authentication server would be available if the server
is marked as unavailable. the default value is 5min. time range is 1-1440.

auth-throttle.description: AP measures request-response times for each packet exchange. As the time taken approaches the timeout, AP throttles new transactions.

dynamic-authorization-port.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.
dynamic-authorization-port.description: Configures the port number for sending AirGroup CoA, instead of the standard CoA port. The default value is 5999.

x-enumDescriptions.STATUS_SERVER:
Status-server messages are used for keeping
RadSec port-access tunnel active
x-enumDescriptions.TCP_KEEPALIVE:
TCP keep alive messages are used for keeping
RadSec port-access tunnel active

radsec-keepalive.x-typeDescription: Method to keep RadSec port-access tunnel active
radsec-keepalive.description: If there is no radius activity for more than 15 minutes, with status-server keepalive, CPPM doesn't terminate connection every 15 minutes, with tcp-keepalive , CPPM terminates the RADSEC connection after 15 minutes

x-enumDescriptions.AUTH_ONLY: Query Status of Auth RADIUS Servers.
x-enumDescriptions.ACCT_ONLY: Query Status of Acct RADIUS Servers.
x-enumDescriptions.NONE: Query Status of auth and accounting RADIUS Servers.

rfc5997.x-typeDescription: Query Status of auth and accounting RADIUS Servers.
rfc5997.description:
When enabled, this parameter allows the Instant AP to send a status-server request to determine the actual status of the authentication or accounting server. This proves useful when there is a authentication or request time
rfc5997—RFC5997 support enabled for both authentication and accounting on the authentication server.
auth-only—RFC5997 support enabled for authentication only.
acct-only—RFC5997 support enabled for accounting only
no rfc5997—Disables RFC5997 support for the authentication server.

msg-auth-required.description:
Enforcement of RADIUS message authenticator. if AP receives Access-Request/Access-Reject/Access-Challenge/CoA-Request/Disconnect-Request without message-authenticator present, the packet will be discarded.
For AP, this configuration is supported from 10.7.1.0.
this field can be configured only when type is RADIUS

tracking-enable.description:
Enable server tracking.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA or TACACS

x-enumDescriptions.ANY: Track the server irrespective of its availability.
x-enumDescriptions.DEAD_ONLY: Track the server only if it is not reachable.

tracking-mode.x-typeDescription: Tracking mode type of the server
tracking-mode.description:
Tracking mode of the server. Default value of tracking-mode is any.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA

x-enumDescriptions.ACCESS_REQUEST: Track the server using access-request messages
x-enumDescriptions.STATUS_SERVER: Track the server using status-server messages
x-enumDescriptions.TCP_KEEPALIVE: Track the server using TCP keep-alive messages

tracking-method.x-typeDescription: Tracking method type of the server
tracking-method.description:
Tracking method of the server. Default value for tracking method is access-request.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA and enable-radsec is set to true.

tls-initial-connection-timeout.description:
TLS Initial connection timeout (timeout for TLS handshake).
For CX, if not specified, the global TLS Initial connection timeout value will be picked.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA and enable-radsec is set to true.

x-enumDescriptions.STATUS_SERVER:
Status-server messages are used for keeping
RadSec port-access tunnel active
x-enumDescriptions.TCP_KEEPALIVE:
TCP keep alive messages are used for keeping
RadSec port-access tunnel active

port-access-keepalive.x-typeDescription: Method to keep RadSec port-access tunnel active
port-access-keepalive.description:
Method to keep RadSec port-access tunnel active. Default value is status-server.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA and enable-radsec is set to true.

shared-secret-config.description: This passkey is used as shared-secret for encrypting the communication between Auth server and device.

cppm-password-config.description:
Auth server Clearpass password configuration used for authentication.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

ipsec-ah.description:
RADIUS server IPsec authentication parameters.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

ipsec-esp.description:
RADIUS server IPsec encryption parameters.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

encryption-type.description: Specify the algorithm to use for IPsec encryption: aes, des or 3des.

x-enumDescriptions.PLAIN_TEXT: Configure plaintext type of IPsec key
x-enumDescriptions.CIPHER_TEXT: Configure ciphertext type of IPsec key
x-enumDescriptions.HEX_STRING: Configure hex-string type of IPsec key

encryption-key-type.x-typeDescription: The key type for the IPsec authentication or the IPsec encryption.
encryption-key-type.description: The key type for IPsec encryption.

encryption-key-hexstring.description:
The hex-string key for IPsec encryption.
This field can be configured only when encryption-key-type is HEX_STRING.

encryption-key-cipher-text.description:
The ciphertext key for IPsec encryption.
This field can be configured only when encryption-key-type is CIPHER_TEXT.

encryption-key.description:
The plaintext key for IPsec encryption.
This field can be configured only when encryption-key-type is PLAIN_TEXT.

ip.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).
ip.description: IP address to be used as source IP for RADIUS packets and subnet mask of the DRP IP address.

vlan.description: VLAN in which the RADIUS packets are sent.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

gateway.description: Gateway IP address of the DRP VLAN

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

name.description: The name of the Auth Server.

type.description:
Auth Server Type. AP support server types are RADIUS, LDAP, TACACS and XMLAPI.
CX supports server types RADIUS and TACACS. PVOS supports RADIUS and TACACS.
Type is a mandatory parameter for CX and PVOS and can not be modified.
GW supports RADIUS, TACACS, WINDOWS and LDAP

x-enumDescriptions.AUTH_ONLY: RADIUS server is used only for authentication.
x-enumDescriptions.COA_ONLY: RADIUS server is used only for Change of Authorization (CoA).
x-enumDescriptions.AUTH_AND_COA: RADIUS server is used for both authentication and CoA.

radius-server-mode.description:
Specifies the mode in which the RADIUS server is used.
- AUTH_ONLY: Server is used only for authentication.
- COA_ONLY: Server is used only for Change of Authorization (CoA).
- AUTH_AND_COA: Server is used for both authentication and CoA.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

The domain-name type represents a DNS domain name.
Fully quallified left to the models which utilize this type.

Internet domain names are only loosely specified.  Section
3.5 of RFC 1034 recommends a syntax (modified in Section
2.1 of RFC 1123).  The pattern above is intended to allow
for current practice in domain name use, and some possible
future expansion.  It is designed to hold various types of
domain names, including names used for A or AAAA records
(host names) and other records, such as SRV records.  Note
that Internet host names have a stricter syntax (described
in RFC 952) than the DNS recommendations in RFCs 1034 and
1123, and that systems that want to store host names in
schema nodes using the domain-name type are recommended to
adhere to this stricter standard to ensure interoperability.

The encoding of DNS names in the DNS protocol is limited
to 255 characters.  Since the encoding consists of labels
prefixed by a length bytes and there is a trailing NULL
byte, only 253 characters can appear in the textual dotted
notation.

Domain-name values use the US-ASCII encoding.  Their canonical
format uses lowercase US-ASCII characters.  Internationalized
domain names MUST be encoded in punycode as described in RFC
3492

auth-server-address.description: IP address or FQDN of the Auth server. For CX and PVOS, auth-server-address is a mandatory parameter and can not be modified.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).

xmlapi-server-key.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.

enable-radsec.description:
Enables RadSec for RADIUS data transport over TCP and TLS
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS.
For CX and PVOS, this parameter cannot be modified.

authentication-type.description:
Specifies authentication protocol which is used for communication with Auth servers.
If not specified, the global timeout value will be picked. This field can be configured only when type is TACACS OR RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

auth-port.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.
auth-port.description:
Port number for authentication requests.For CX, default auth-port for RADIUS Servers is 1812 and TACACS Servers is 49.
For CX and PVOS, this parameter cannot be modified.

acct-port.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.
acct-port.description:
Port number for accounting requests.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

tcp-port.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.
tcp-port.description:
Port number used by the server.
This field can be configured only when type is TACACS

max-retransmit-attempts.description:
Maximum number of retries sent to the server by the manager device(AP, GW and SW_CX) before the server is marked as down.
For AP, the default value is 3.
For CX, range is 0-5. If not specified, the global retry value will be picked.

timeout.description:
Maximum time, in seconds, that the manager device(AP, GW and SW_CX) waits before timing out the request and resending it.
For CX, range is 1-60. If not specified, the global timeout value will be picked.
For AP, the default value of RADIUS and LDAP is 5, TACACS is 20.
This field can be configured only when type is TACACS, LDAP, or RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

source-address.description: Source IP address to use in messages to the Auth server

source-interface.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
source-interface.description:
Source VLAN Interface to use in messages to the Auth server
This field can be configured only when type is TACACS or RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

nas-ip-address.description: The NAS IP address to be sent in RADIUS packets from that server.

nas-identifier.description:
NAS identifier to use in RADIUS packets.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

cppm-user-name.description:
User name of the ClearPass server to authenticate.
For CX, supported length is 2-64.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

x-enumDescriptions.STANDARD: Follow RFC, the default Service-Type for 802.1x is framed, for CP is Login, for mac is Call-Back.
x-enumDescriptions.FRAMED: Change Service-Type default value to framed for 802.1x, CP and MAC auth.

service-type.x-typeDescription: Change the default value of service type.
service-type.description:
Change Service Type default value to framed.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA

use-ip-for-calling-station-id.description:
Use IP for Calling Station Id.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

use-md5.description:
Use MD5 hash for cleartext password.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

lower-case-mac-address.description:
Lower case MAC address.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

mac-address-delimiter.description:
MAC address delimiter.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

vrf.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.
vrf.description:
VRF for the Auth server.
For CX, this parameter cannot be modified.

management-interface.description: Out of Band management interface for the Auth server.

radsec-port.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.
radsec-port.description:
Designates a RadSec port for RADIUS data transport
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA and enable-radsec is set to true.
For CX and PVOS, this parameter cannot be modified.

radsec-client-cert.description:
RADIUS Security Client Certificate Name.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA

radsec-trusted-cacert-name.description:
RADIUS Security Trusted CA Cert Name.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA

radsec-trusted-servercert-name.description:
RADIUS Security Server Certificate Name.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

radsec-est-cert-profile.description:
RADIUS Security Server Certificate Name.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

admin-dn.description:
DN for the admin user who has read or search privileges across all of the entries in the LDAP database (the user does not need
write privileges but should be able to search the database and read attributes of other users in the database).
This field can be configured only when type is LDAP.

admin-password.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
admin-password.description:
Password for the admin user.
this field can be configured only when type is LDAP.

base-dn.description:
DN name of the node which contains the entire user database to use.
this field can be configured only when type is LDAP.

allow-cleartext.description:
Allow unencrypted communication with LDAP server.
this field can be configured only when type is LDAP.

chase-referrals.description:
LDAP Chase Referrals.
this field can be configured only when type is LDAP.

filter.description:
Filter that should be applied to search of the user in the LDAP database.
this field can be configured only when type is LDAP

key-attribute.description:
The attribute that should be used as a key in search
for the LDAP server. This field can be configured only when type is LDAP

max-connection.description:
Maximum number of simultaneous non-admin connections to a LDAP server.
this field can be configured only when type is LDAP

session-authorization.description:
Enable TACACS+ authorization.
this field can be configured only when type is TACACS.

domain.description:
Windows domain name.
this field can be configured only when type is WINDOWS.

replay-protection.description:
Replay protection for DAC(Dynamic Authorization Client) requests
this field can be configured only when type is RADIUS and radius-server-mode is equal to COA_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

x-enumDescriptions.POSITIVE: Sets the acceptable time-window value as default PLUS
x-enumDescriptions.PLUS_OR_MINUS: Sets the acceptable time-window value as PLUS OR MINUS

window-type.x-typeDescription: Time-window value type for dynamic authorization messages.

event-timestamp-required.description:
Discard DAC request, if Event-Timestamp is not present
in DAC(Dynamic Authorization Client) request. This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as COA_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

default-authenticated-role.description:
Assign default role for users after XML server
 authorization.

x-enumDescriptions.CLEAR_TEXT: set preferred connection type as Clear-Text
x-enumDescriptions.LDAP_S: set preferred connection type as LDAP-S
x-enumDescriptions.START_TLS: set preferred connection type as START-TLS

preferred-conn-type.x-typeDescription: Include VLAN identifier of port in acce7ss-request
preferred-conn-type.description:
Preferred Connection Type.
this field can be configured only when type is LDAP.

auth-modifier.description:
Attributes modifier for authentication-request.
this field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

acct-modifier.description:
Attributes modifier for accounting-request.
this field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA

deadtime.description:
Configures a dead time interval for the authentication server. When two or more authentication servers are configured on the Instant AP and
a server is unavailable, the dead time configuratidetermines the duration for which the authentication server would be available if the server
is marked as unavailable. the default value is 5min. time range is 1-1440.

auth-throttle.description: AP measures request-response times for each packet exchange. As the time taken approaches the timeout, AP throttles new transactions.

dynamic-authorization-port.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.
dynamic-authorization-port.description: Configures the port number for sending AirGroup CoA, instead of the standard CoA port. The default value is 5999.

x-enumDescriptions.STATUS_SERVER:
Status-server messages are used for keeping
RadSec port-access tunnel active
x-enumDescriptions.TCP_KEEPALIVE:
TCP keep alive messages are used for keeping
RadSec port-access tunnel active

radsec-keepalive.x-typeDescription: Method to keep RadSec port-access tunnel active
radsec-keepalive.description: If there is no radius activity for more than 15 minutes, with status-server keepalive, CPPM doesn't terminate connection every 15 minutes, with tcp-keepalive , CPPM terminates the RADSEC connection after 15 minutes

x-enumDescriptions.AUTH_ONLY: Query Status of Auth RADIUS Servers.
x-enumDescriptions.ACCT_ONLY: Query Status of Acct RADIUS Servers.
x-enumDescriptions.NONE: Query Status of auth and accounting RADIUS Servers.

rfc5997.x-typeDescription: Query Status of auth and accounting RADIUS Servers.
rfc5997.description:
When enabled, this parameter allows the Instant AP to send a status-server request to determine the actual status of the authentication or accounting server. This proves useful when there is a authentication or request time
rfc5997—RFC5997 support enabled for both authentication and accounting on the authentication server.
auth-only—RFC5997 support enabled for authentication only.
acct-only—RFC5997 support enabled for accounting only
no rfc5997—Disables RFC5997 support for the authentication server.

msg-auth-required.description:
Enforcement of RADIUS message authenticator. if AP receives Access-Request/Access-Reject/Access-Challenge/CoA-Request/Disconnect-Request without message-authenticator present, the packet will be discarded.
For AP, this configuration is supported from 10.7.1.0.
this field can be configured only when type is RADIUS

tracking-enable.description:
Enable server tracking.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA or TACACS

x-enumDescriptions.ANY: Track the server irrespective of its availability.
x-enumDescriptions.DEAD_ONLY: Track the server only if it is not reachable.

tracking-mode.x-typeDescription: Tracking mode type of the server
tracking-mode.description:
Tracking mode of the server. Default value of tracking-mode is any.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA

x-enumDescriptions.ACCESS_REQUEST: Track the server using access-request messages
x-enumDescriptions.STATUS_SERVER: Track the server using status-server messages
x-enumDescriptions.TCP_KEEPALIVE: Track the server using TCP keep-alive messages

tracking-method.x-typeDescription: Tracking method type of the server
tracking-method.description:
Tracking method of the server. Default value for tracking method is access-request.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA and enable-radsec is set to true.

tls-initial-connection-timeout.description:
TLS Initial connection timeout (timeout for TLS handshake).
For CX, if not specified, the global TLS Initial connection timeout value will be picked.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA and enable-radsec is set to true.

x-enumDescriptions.STATUS_SERVER:
Status-server messages are used for keeping
RadSec port-access tunnel active
x-enumDescriptions.TCP_KEEPALIVE:
TCP keep alive messages are used for keeping
RadSec port-access tunnel active

port-access-keepalive.x-typeDescription: Method to keep RadSec port-access tunnel active
port-access-keepalive.description:
Method to keep RadSec port-access tunnel active. Default value is status-server.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA and enable-radsec is set to true.

shared-secret-config.description: This passkey is used as shared-secret for encrypting the communication between Auth server and device.

cppm-password-config.description:
Auth server Clearpass password configuration used for authentication.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

ipsec-ah.description:
RADIUS server IPsec authentication parameters.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

ipsec-esp.description:
RADIUS server IPsec encryption parameters.
This field can be configured only when type is RADIUS with radius-server-mode configured as AUTH_ONLY or AUTH_AND_COA.

encryption-type.description: Specify the algorithm to use for IPsec encryption: aes, des or 3des.

x-enumDescriptions.PLAIN_TEXT: Configure plaintext type of IPsec key
x-enumDescriptions.CIPHER_TEXT: Configure ciphertext type of IPsec key
x-enumDescriptions.HEX_STRING: Configure hex-string type of IPsec key

encryption-key-type.x-typeDescription: The key type for the IPsec authentication or the IPsec encryption.
encryption-key-type.description: The key type for IPsec encryption.

encryption-key-hexstring.description:
The hex-string key for IPsec encryption.
This field can be configured only when encryption-key-type is HEX_STRING.

encryption-key-cipher-text.description:
The ciphertext key for IPsec encryption.
This field can be configured only when encryption-key-type is CIPHER_TEXT.

encryption-key.description:
The plaintext key for IPsec encryption.
This field can be configured only when encryption-key-type is PLAIN_TEXT.

ip.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).
ip.description: IP address to be used as source IP for RADIUS packets and subnet mask of the DRP IP address.

vlan.description: VLAN in which the RADIUS packets are sent.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

gateway.description: Gateway IP address of the DRP VLAN

spi.description: Security Parameters Index for the Security Association

authentication-type.description: Specify the algorithm to use for IPsec authentication: md5, sha1 or sha256.

x-enumDescriptions.PLAIN_TEXT: Configure plaintext type of IPsec key
x-enumDescriptions.CIPHER_TEXT: Configure ciphertext type of IPsec key
x-enumDescriptions.HEX_STRING: Configure hex-string type of IPsec key

authentication-key-type.x-typeDescription: The key type for the IPsec authentication or the IPsec encryption.
authentication-key-type.description: The key type for IPsec authentication.

authentication-key-hexstring.description:
The hex-string key for IPsec authentication.
This field can only be set when authentication-key-type is HEX_STRING.

authentication-key-cipher-text.description:
The ciphertext key for IPsec authentication.
This field can only be set when authentication-key-type is CIPHER_TEXT.

authentication-key.description:
The plaintext key for IPsec authentication.
This field can only be set when authentication-key-type is PLAIN_TEXT.

called-station-id.description:
Configure this parameter to be sent with the RADIUS attribute Called Station ID for authentication and accounting requests. For AP, this API is applicable for
WLAN profile and AP port profile. For GW, this API is applicable for the authentication server profile. This feature is applicable for AP and GW.

type.description:
Configure the called-station-id types.
For AP, The type includes AP group, AP MAC address, AP name, AP IP or user vlan. The default value is AP MAC address.

mac-address-delimiter.description: By default, called-station-id is AP MAC Address string and no delimiter, when configure mac-address-delimiter, AP MAC Address will be added delimiter in authentication packet.

upper-case.description: By default, called-station-id is AP MAC Address string, when enabled upper-case, AP MAC Address will be changed to upper case in authentication packet.

include-ssid-delimiter.description: The delimiter between mac address and SSID. For example, the delimiter is dash. The called-station-id like aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff-wlanssid.

secret-type.description: Specify the secret key type: CIPHER_TEXT or PLAIN_TEXT.

ciphertext-value.description:
The encrypted shared key used between the authentication
server and the device. This field can be configured only when secret-type is CIPHER_TEXT.

plaintext-value.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
plaintext-value.description:
The unencrypted shared key used between the authentication
server and the device. This field can be configured only when secret-type is PLAIN_TEXT.

ArubaAuthServer_CppmPasswordInfo.description: Group for CPPM password of the user

password-type.description: Specify the password type: CIPHER_TEXT or PLAIN_TEXT.

ciphertext-value.description:
Ciphertext password of the ClearPass server to authenticate. This field can be configured only when password-type is CIPHER_TEXT.
For CX, supported length is 1-64.

plaintext-value.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
plaintext-value.description:
Plaintext password of the ClearPass server to authenticate. This field can be configured only when password-type is PLAIN_TEXT.
For CX, supported length is 1-64.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
